blog.title: Exploring with Susan
blog.blurb:
Welcome back to the design blog I have begun dedicating to my various vehicles. Today was a day I decided to seize the sun, and practice working with light and my beautiful Vespa. Driving her around the city and taking different photos helped me stretch my creative muscles, as well as indulge in the fact that she doesnâ€™t need any repairs.

As soon as I stepped outside this morning I could feel my shoulders starting to turn red, a sure sign of summer. Although I work as a graphic designer, photography is a personal love of mine and I often use my own visuals in my designs...

blog.title: Getting Inspired in St. Louis
blog.blurb:
Today I took Big John on a ride around St.Louis. I've been visiting here as part of a project I'm consulting on as an Art Director. I've really enjoyed finding new parts of the city to sketch, photograph and just be inspired by.

The differences in each photo bring me so much creative joy. Being able to show so many different sides of the same city is...

blog.title: Challenging Myself with Neutrals
blog.blurb:
This week I decided to try something new on my photography adventures. With Susan carrying me around and my favorite camera tucked safely into its carrying case I set out to find and photograph only neutrals. I felt the need to stretch my creative muscles and thought this would be an interesting and fun way to do it.

The most challenging part was not taking a photo of everything and anything that caught my eye, which is what I usually do. It was really focusing on the goal and narrowing down what fit the creative...
